entries.name: Silithids
entries: Silithids are frightful insectoids, living in large colonies excavated beneath scorching sands. Although their individual strength is questionable at best, a colony's collective hive-mind can send signals and pain surging through the hive to alert its members of intruders.

They range dramatically in size. Beginning their life as small insignificant larva, they grow into the swarms of monstrosities that make up their flock. Whatever their size may be, they all resemble massive insects -- if those insects were grotesquely mutated and thirsting for flesh.

entries.name: Spawns of Qiraji
entries: As the kingdom of the aqir was left in ruins, those who remained split in two and ventured in opposite directions. One grouped traveled far south, where they found and ransacked a titan research station near Uldum. Turning the facility into a hive, they renamed themselves the qiraji -- and their new home, Ahn'Qiraj.

But their new hive held a dark secret: it was the prison of C'Thun, one of the Old Gods who had ruled primordial Azeroth. Just as the aqir before them had served him, the qiraji quickly bowed down to his will.

The facility was transformed from a prison into a seat of power, one from which the qiraji grew over milennia into an army; one capable of exacting the Old God's revenge. The key to Cthun's plan was the creation of the silithid: a race of insectoid creatures born from the qiraji, one with which Ahn'Qiraj would be poised to as a new empire.

entries.name: Bestial Drones
entries: Unlike the qiraji, silithids aren't sentient beings. They are slavering beasts at most, linked together in a hive-mind that spans the entirety of southern Kalimdor.
C'Thun created them to be mindless servants of the qiraji; minions that would be eternally loyal to their masters -- and in turn to C'Thun himself.

entries.name: Collective Hive-Mind
entries: Although silithids might seem to be acting on their own accord, their actions are all the exertion of their hive collective. This, however, does not make them any less dangerous.
A hive of silithids are controlled by one or more colossi, whose masive -- sometimes exposed -- brain keeps a tidy order of all other members of its hive, directing them.

The colossi in turn are controlled by the qiraji, whose dominance over the race is absolute. Hives typically possess a strange crystalline prism, hidden deep within its core, through which the qiraji communicate with them.

entries.name: Adaptable Hive
entries: No other creature can adapt to changes in their environment as quickly as the silithid.

Adventurers daring enough to delve into the heart of a silithid hive, hoping to kill its colossi and hamper the colony as a whole, will soon find it replaced. Before long, another colossi will have taken over before long; acting as a surrogate until a new one can rise from the hive's young.

entries.name: Hive Controller
entries: The strongest of a hive's colossi exerts direct command over other silithids in the hive. Usually this is either the hive lord, closest of the queen's consorts, or the hive queen herself.
The Hive Controller can be distinguished by its see-through cranium, leaving its brain visible. It has the following additional trait.

entries.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the silithid can send a telepathic command whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 60 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can receive the command. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the silithid is incapacitated.
{@note List of Silithids}

entries.name: [PH]
entries: [PH]

{@note List of Mantid}

entries.name: N'raqi - Faceless Ones
entries: The n'raqi -- or more commonly known -- the faceless ones are a monstrous kin, brought forth from the organic matter that seeped away from the Old Gods in primordial times, before the Titans brought about the ordering of Azeroth. Cunning and intelligent, they serve their eldritch masters with fanatical devotion. Tales of their unspeakable deeds paint them as unstoppable juggernauts.

entries.name: Spawn of the Old Gods
entries: The faceless ones are the creation of the Old Gods, in the most literal sense of the word. They are shaped from the Old Gods' own flesh and blood; trickled from their eternal prisons through the core of the planet, like bile through the gutters.

Some of these aberrations are unique, while others are so uniform as to be virtually identical. They are all loyal to the gods that spawned them forth, unwavering in their devotion to the will of their creators.

entries.name: Unexpected Allies
entries: These eldritch horrors are powerful, but not innumerable. What they lack in either is quickly recouped by corrupting other beings that happen in their path. Even a faceless one on its own is almost guaranteed to never truly be alone.
The faceless ones keep a few valuable allies, such as the Naga, while simultaneously seeding hatred and distrust even among the most loyal of factions.

entries.name: Corrupting Presence
entries: Faceless ones carry the stain of the Old Gods with the, wherever they go, and their presence alone can change things for the worse. Life is tainted in their wake, slowly twisted around as friends become foes and alliances dissolve into bitter hatred.
Whether by instilling paranoia or asserting dominance directly, the faceless ones will always seek to divide and conquer.

entries.name: Return of the Black Empire
entries: The Old Gods once ruled over Azeroth, in a time long before mortal races saw the light of day. Locked away by the Titans, they have long ever since to return to power -- an end to which their faceless servants are the means by which they act.
Long have they sown the seeds of corruption, turning the denizens of the world against one another, so that they can break free and seize control once more.

entries.name: Zoatroid
entries: Many would see the small, squid-like zoatroid as utterly inconsequential. Nowhere near as dangerous as the towering n'raqi. Fools are those who underestimate them, as these merciless critters hunt to gain complete of their victims -- which they do by latching onto the face of a suitable target in order to bore into its mind.

Zoatroids have found a second home among the Naga, saiding their serpentine allies by infiltrating and corrupting their enemies. Some zoatroids are only able to seize control of a creature's body, while others are able to claim both body and mind as their own.

entries.name: Royal Zoatroid
entries: A royal zoatroid has a challenge rating of 6 (2,300 XP). It has the same statistics as a zoatroid except that it adds its Wisdom modifier to its Armor Class (AC 17) and gains the following additional trait:

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The zoatroid has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.
The royal zoatroid has the following action option in place of the zoatroid's Enslave:

entries.name: Dominate (Recharge 6)
entries: One humanoid grappled by the zoatroid must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be dominated by the zoatroid: the dominated target goes on the zoatroids initiative, it controls the target using its action. The {@i Dominate} deprives the target of its vision but not its awareness. The royal zoatroid can be targeted by attacks, spells, and other effects but any attack roll that misses the zoatroid automatically hits its dominated target.
The domination lasts until the target drops to 0 hit points, the zoatroid ends it as a bonus action, or a creature uses their action to attempt a grapple check contested by the zoatroid.
{@note List of Faceless Ones}

data.name: Aberrations
entries: This sections contains creatures of unknown origins
{@note List of Abberrations}

entries.name: Fleshbeast
entries: Though the exact origin of these monstrous aberrations is unknown, the theories are many. Some even go so far as to claim them a product of the Twisting Nether itself, pulled from there onto other worlds.

entries.name: Nightmare Made Flesh
entries: Slavering, hungering monstrosities, the best way to describe the terrifying fleshbeasts are plainly as creatures of nightmare. Their presence has been witnessed both on Azeroth and beyond, as they appear to tail along on magical experiments that try to exploit the powers of the Twisting Nether, using them as rifts through which they can travel between worlds.

entries.name: Parasitic Brood
entries: Fleshbeasts are decidedly mindless, acting entirely on instinct. They hunt by flocking together in large swarms, overpowering their prey and consuming it, sometimes while it is still alive. Even after the fleshbeast has had its fill, most of the victim will still be left behind intact -- a perfect nesting ground for their wormlike spawn, who will later devour the remains as they hatch.
Other predators attempting to scavenge remains left behind by a fleshbeast will most likely be infected as well, and later devoured by the hatchlings.

disease.name: Plague of Undeath
entries: While there have been several plagues throughout history, when someone mentions "{@i the} plague," they are referring to the Plague of Undeath, a deadly necromantic disease that ravaged most of the Eastern Kingdoms during the Third War.

The Plague affects species differently. The original Plague mostly killed humanoids, causing them to rise as zombies and other undead, while some flora and fauna instead sprouted plague-filled growths. The New Plague developed by certain Forsaken apothecaries could even kill the undead. Other variants have existed, developed in alchemical labs and secret cabals.

When a creature is exposed to a source of the plague -- such as through breathing spores, eating infested grain, or an open wound -- they must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, contracting the disease on a failure.

It takes {@dice 1d4} days for the plague's symptoms to manifest in an infected creature. Symptoms range from fatigue, nausea, fever, to minor hallucinations. When it manifests, the infected creature suffers one level of exhaustion and regains only half the normal number of hit points from spending Hit Dice and no hit points from finishing a long rest.

At the end of each long rest, an infected creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains one level of exhaustion. On a successful save, the creature's exhaustion level decreases by one level. If a successful saving throw reduces the infected creature's level of exhaustion below 1, the creature recovers from the disease.

The plague is resistant to magic. It cannot be cured except by removing exhaustion levels, and immunity to disease only provides advantage on saves against it. If a creature dies from exhaustion while under this disease, necromantic energies infect the body. Every 24 hours it has a 5% chance to rise as an uncontrolled zombie. If {@i {@spell create undead}} or similar spells are cast on the corpse, they do not require material components and the created undead remain under the caster's control indefinitely.

disease.name: Radiation Sickness
entries: When an uninfected creature comes into contact with a source of radiation — such as contaminated water, being bitten by an infected creature, or for every hour spent in a high-radiation area — the creature must succeed on a DC 11 a Constitution saving throw or contract the radiation disease.

It takes 1d4 days for the disease to manifest. As it does, the creature's skin takes on a sickly green tint and abscesses start to spread across its surface. At the end of that period, the creature gains advantage on saving throws against poison and resistance against poison damage. However, the creature also has disadvantage on all Strength and Dexterity ability checks, as well as weapon attack rolls.

Once a creature has carried the radiation disease for more than two weeks, its skin turns completely green. It no longer suffers from disadvantage on ability checks or weapon attacks, but it gains an {@table indefinite madness|DMG} as described in the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG|8|Going Mad}.

The radiation symptoms can be cured by a spell, such as {@spell lesser restoration}. Once the disease has manifested, a more potent spell such as {@spell greater restoration} or {@spell heal} is required.

reward.name: Worgen Curse
entries: A humanoid bit by a worgen must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed. The curse has no effect on undead beings, such as the forsaken. A character bit begins to show the effects of the curse after 1d4 days, at which point the character is transformed into a feral worgen. It gains a Strength of 15 if their score isn't already higher, and their alignment changes to Chaotic Evil.
The cursed character also gains the following indefinite madness, "I hunger for the taste of blood and will kill anyone to taste it once more."

The character remains a feral worgen until a {@spell greater restoration} spell or more powerful magic rids the character of their indefinite madness, at which point alignment returns to what it was before being bit, and the character gains the {@i Two Forms} feature and the {@i Worgen Form Traits} of the Worgen race.

legendaryGroup.name: Hogger
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Hogger takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: Hogger screams for aid. 1d4 {@creature Gnoll|WC5E MoM|gnolls} within 300 feet of Hogger that can hear him rush to his side, appearing in a space within 60 feet of him. This lair action has no effect if there are no gnolls within 300 feet of Hogger.
Each gnoll that Hogger can see can use its reaction to move up to its speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Until the next initiative count 20, all gnolls within the lair are enraged, causing them to have advantage on melee weapon attack rolls and causing attack rolls to have advantage against them.

regionalEffects: Hogger's lair might have any or all of the following effects in place:

items: The lair is considered difficult terrain for any non-gnoll creature that moves across it.
Any gnoll within the lair has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the yeti moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The yeti's long jump is up to 40 ft. and its high jump is up to 20 ft., with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The yeti makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Roar
entries: The yeti emits a roar. Each creature within 30 feet of the yeti and able to hear the roar must make a DC15 Wisdom saving throw, being Frightened for 1 minute on a fail. A Frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the roar of all yetis for 1 day.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the yeti jumps at least 20 ft. as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 30 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

On a successful save, the creature takes only half of the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone} and is pushed 5 ft. out of the yeti space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the yeti space.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The yeti exhales an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 6d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Claw Attack
entries: The yeti makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Leap Attack (Cost 2 actions)
entries: The yeti makes a deadly leap attack.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The abomination is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the abomination must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all abominations for 1 minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The abomination makes two attacks: one with its cleaver and one with its horrific hook.

action.name: Cleaver
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Horrific Hook
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} and pulled to an empty space next to the abomination.

monster.name: Abyssal

immune.note: damage from nonmagical attacks not made with adamantine weapons.

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Immolation Aura
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the infernal, or hits it with a melee weapon attack, takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: the infernal is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: the infernal has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: the infernal deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The infernal make two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage + 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The revenant's spellcating ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}) and casts as a 17th level spellcaster. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Buffeting Winds
entries: Ranged attacks against the revenant have disadvantage on the attack rolls.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The revenant's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The revenant makes four mace attacks.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Lightning Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: The revenant makes one mace attack. If the attack hits, it deals an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) lightning damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) thunder damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the revenant's next turn.

trait.name: DANGER!
entries: When the alarm-o-bot notices a creature that isn't a construct or gnome it sends out a warning that can be heard within 240 feet of it.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The alarm-o-bot is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}0 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Beast of Burden
entries: The kodo is considered to be a Gargantuan animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the kodo moves at least 20 feet straight towards a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the kodo can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Gore
entries: Melee Attack Weapon: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: Melee Attack Weapon: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage. A Medium or smaller target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or swallowed by the kodo. The kodo can only have one target swallowed at a time. If a target fails the saving throw while the kodo has a creature swallowed, it is {@condition grappled} instead.

A swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kodo, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the kodo's turns.

If the kodo takes 15 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the kodo must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the kodo. If the kodo dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ancient remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The ancient deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ancient makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Take Root
entries: The ancient buries its roots in the ground. While rooted, the ancient's speed becomes 0, it gains advantage on its attack rolls, and is immune to any effect that would force the ancient to move or be moved. The ancient can end this effect by repeating this action to uproot itself.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ancient is a 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The ancient has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ancient remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Nature's Blessing
entries: The tree add its Wisdom modifier to its Armor Class (AC 19).

trait.name: Rooted Tranquility
entries: While the tree have taken root, each plant of the tree's choice within 60 feet of it regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the plant takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the plant's next turn. A plant dies if it starts its turn with 0 hit points.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The ancient deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Speak with Nature
entries: The ancient can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Take Root
entries: The ancient buries its roots in the ground. While rooted, the ancient's speed becomes 0, it gains advantage on its attack rolls, and is immune to any effect that would force the ancient to move or be moved. The ancient can end this effect by repeating this action to uproot itself.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ancient makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 5d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Summon Wisps (1/Day)
entries: The tree calls forth ten wisps that appear in empty spaces within 60 feet of it. These wisps act as allies of the tree. The wisps remains for 1 day or until they die.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ancient is a 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The ancient has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ancient remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The ancient deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Speak with Nature
entries: The ancient can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ancient makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 5d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Take Root
entries: The ancient buries its roots in the ground. While rooted, the ancient's speed becomes 0, it gains advantage on its attack rolls, and is immune to any effect that would force the ancient to move or be moved. The ancient can end this effect by repeating this action to uproot itself.

variant.name: Tree of Life
entries: A tree of life is a sapling born from the world tree Nordrassil, these ancients have suffered great losses in recent wars, and those who remain have returned to the forest to spread their seeds and replenish their numbers undisturbed.
A tree of life has a challenge rating of 10 (5,900 XP). It has the same statistics as an ancient of lore, and gains the following additional traits:

entries.name: Nature's Blessing.
entries: The tree add its Wisdom modifier to its Armor Class (AC 19).

entries.name: Rooted Tranquility.
entries: While the tree have taken root, each plant of the tree's choice within 60 feet of it regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the plant takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the plant's next turn. A plant dies if it starts its turn with 0 hit points.

entries.name: Spellcasting.
entries: The tree has the following additional spells prepared.

items: 4th level: {@i {@spell guardian of nature|xge}, {@spell grasping vine}}

entries: The tree has the following additional action option:

entries.name: Summon {@creature Wisp|WC5E MoM|Wisps} (1/Day).
entries: The tree calls forth ten wisps that appear in empty spaces within 60 feet of it. These wisps act as allies of the tree. The wisps remains for 1 day or until they die.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ancient remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Resilient Nature
entries: Unless the ancient of war is incapacitated, it and plant creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The ancient deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ancient makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 5d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}42 ({@dice 8d8 + 6}) bludgeoning.

action.name: Take Root
entries: The ancient buries its roots in the ground. While rooted, the ancient's speed becomes 0, it gains advantage on its attack rolls, and is immune to any effect that would force the ancient to move or be moved. The ancient can end this effect by repeating this action to uproot itself.

action.name: Animate Trees (1/Day)
entries: The ancient magically animates five or fewer trees that it can see within 60 feet of it. The trees have the statistics of a treant, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1 and they only have the Claw action. An animated tree acts as an ally of the ancient. The tree remains animated for 1 day, until it dies, or until the ancient takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. If the tree doesn't die and is made inanimate, it takes root again if it can.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 25/50 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Apparition
languages: understands any language it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The apparition is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The apparition has the following mage spells prepared:

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The apparition can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the apparition has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw} Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 4d6 + 1}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The aranasi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the aranasi knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The aranasi ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Demon Web {@recharge 5}
entries: The aranasi spits webbing at a point it can see within 60 feet. The webbing fills a 20-foot-radius circle from that point, and counts as difficult terrain.

Any creature that starts its turn in the webs or that enters them during its turn must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and is {@condition restrained} as long as it remains in the webs or until it breaks free.

A creature {@condition restrained} by the webs can use its action to make a {@dc 15} Strength check. If the check succeeds, it is no longer {@condition restrained}. The webbs have AC 10, 15 hit points, resistance to fire damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and psychic damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aranasi's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}). The aranasi can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the aranasi fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The aranasi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the aranasi knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The aranasi ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

trait.name: Demonic Terror
entries: Any non-demonic creature who sees the aranasi must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition frightened} of the aranasi, and must repeat the saving throw at the start of each turn. A creature who succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack:
entries: The aranasi makes two attacks with her claws.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Demon Web {@recharge 5}
entries: The aranasi broodmother spits webbing at a point it can see within 60 feet. The webbing fills a 20-foot-radius circle from that point, and counts as difficult terrain.

Any creature that starts its turn in the webs or that enters them during its turn must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage and is {@condition restrained} as long as it remains in the webs or until it breaks free.

A creature {@condition restrained} by the webs can use its action to make a {@dc 15} Strength check. If the check succeeds, it is no longer {@condition restrained}. The webs have AC 10, 15 hit points, resistance to fire damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and psychic damage.

action.name: Come, My Children (1/Day)
entries: The aranasi broodmother calls forth {@dice 2d4 + 2} aranasi spiderlings, which arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds. These spiderlings appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the aranasi broodmother, acts as an ally of the aranasi broodmother, and obeying any spoken commands. These spiderlings remains for 1 minute, until it or the aranasi broodmother dies, or until the aranasi broodmother dismisses them as an action.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The aranasi broodmother moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Claw Attack
entries: The aranasi broodmother makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Feed, My Children (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each aranasi that can see and hear the aranasi broodmother can use its reaction to make one weapon attack against a target of its choice.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spiderling can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spiderling ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Arcane Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The golem's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}). The golem can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapon
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Arcane Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage.

action.name: Slow {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The nullifier is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nullifier makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Slow {@recharge 5}
entries: The nullifier targets one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The creature must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, the creature can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the creature can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The effect lasts for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

action.name: Nullify (Recharge after a Long Rest)
entries: The nullifier attempts to dispel all magical effects within 30 feet of it, as if it had cast the {@spell dispel magic} as a 3rd-level spell on everything within range.

reaction.name: Reflection Field
entries: When a creature hits the nullifier with a ranged spell attack, the nullifier can reflect the spell onto a target within 15 feet of it.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the wyrm dies, it explodes in a burst of arcane. Each creature within 15 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Magic Sense
entries: The wyrm can sense magic users within 30 feet of it, and focus its attacks on those creatures.

trait.name: Mana Burn
entries: Whenever the wyrm hits a target with its bite, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw or have their lowest available spell slot expended. The target regains any spell slots lost in this way when they finish a short rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wyrm makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) force damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) if the wyrm isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Faerie Fire (1/Day)
entries: The wyrm manifests the effects of a {@spell faerie fire} spell within 60 feet of it (spell save {@dc 12}).

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The moth sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

An {@b ashwing moth} is a nocturnal creature, best known for its vibrant light. Assassins prize them for it, using it as a decoy or distraction, as well as a subtle light in dark places. An ashwing moth in captivity sheds light for up to {@dice 1d8} days.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

{@b Axebeaks} are jungle birds with multicolored chest plumage. They are named after their brightly colored bills, which are razor sharp and help them crack open thick tropical fruit and chop open the corpses they scavenge.

trait.name: Detect Life
entries: The banshee can magically sense the presence of living creatures up to 5 miles away. She knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The banshee can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The banshee can use its Banshee's Curse. It then makes two attacks with its withering touch.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Banshee's Curse
entries: One creature of the banshee's choice within 60 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on all ability checks, saving throws, and attack rolls until the end of the banshee's next turn.

action.name: Wail {@recharge 4}
entries: The banshee releases a mournful wail. This wail has no effect on constructs and undead. All other creatures within 30 feet of her that can hear her must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d12}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Possession (1/Day)
entries: One humanoid that the banshee can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the banshee; the banshee then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The banshee now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The banshee can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the banshee ends it as a bonus action, or the banshee is turned or forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends, the banshee reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body.

reaction.name: Anti-magic Shell
entries: The banshee adds 3 to its AC against one spell attack that would hit it. To do so, the banshee must see the attacker.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the lasher remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary orchid.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lasher makes two thorn slash attacks.

action.name: Thorn Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Thorn Volley
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Thorn Shield
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the lasher hits it with a melee attack, the creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the lasher remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary flower.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lasher makes two thorn slash attacks.

action.name: Thorn Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Whirlwind Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: The lasher lashes out in all directions with thorny vines, tearing any opponent within range. Each creature in a 10-foot radius centered on the lasher must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the boar takes 7 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Detonate
entries: When the bombling dies, it detonates in a 10-foot radius explosion. Any creature within range must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The bombling is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Self-destruct
entries: The bombling immediately detonates, killing itself in the process.

monster.name: Bone Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The bone golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bone golem makes two melee attacks, or three melee attacks if it has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Bone Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bone Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft, one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Bone Storm
entries: At the start of each of the bone wraith's turns, each creature within 10 feet of it takes 7 ({@dice 2d6}) slashing and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the bone wraith fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The bone wraith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The bone wraith's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Three Heads
entries: The bone wraiths has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bone wraith uses its Graveyard Spike and then makes two melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Bone Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bone Slice
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10ft., up to three targets. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d12 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Graveyard Spike
entries: A medium sized spike of bone raises from the ground within 60 ft. of the bone wraith. A creature in the same space must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity save or take 11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage and be {@condition restrained}. A {@condition restrained} creature can use an action to try to break free by succeeding on a {@dc 19} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. While {@condition restrained} in this way, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage at the start of each of the bone wraith's turns. On a successful save the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Coldflame {@recharge 5}
entries: The bone wraith exhales an icy blast in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 12d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Bone Storm
entries: Any creature within the bone wraith's bone storm aura must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@dice 2d6}) slashing and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The bone wraith makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Spine Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The bone wraith strikes its spinal wing towards a creature. Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength check or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The bone wraith can have maximum two creatures {@condition grappled} this way.

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Whirlwind {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature in the elemental's space must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and is flung up to 20 feet away from the elemental in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.
If the save is successful, the target takes half the damage and isn't flung away or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the elemental can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Fel Flames
entries: Fire damage that the elemental deals ignores other creatures' fire resistance and treats fire immunity as resistance instead.

trait.name: Heat Aura
entries: A creature that hits the elemental with a melee attack while within 5 feet of the elemental or ends their turn there takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The elemental sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light in an additional 30 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: Melee Weapon Attack. {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) fire damage.

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The elemental sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light in an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two touch attacks

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of its turn.

trait.name: Frost Form
entries: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical unworked ice and snow. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage. Additionally, the elemental freezes non-creature liquids within a 10-foot radius of it. A creature caught in the liquid when the elemental freezes it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The elemental can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost extra movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam or icicle attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Icicle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d12}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Water Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Freeze
entries: If the elemental takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Whelm {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature in the elemental's space must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If it is Large or smaller, it is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the elemental's space.

The elemental can grapple one Large creature or up to two Medium or smaller creatures at one time. At the start of each of the elemental's turns, each target {@condition grappled} by it takes 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. A creature within 5 feet of the elemental can pull a creature or object out of it by taking an action to make a {@dc 14} Strength and succeeding.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The bear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bear makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 7d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 30 feet away from the brutosaur and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The carrion bird has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The carrion bird has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the bird's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

A {@b carrion bird} is a large, carnivorous scavenger bird found across Azeroth. Their wings are broad and their heads often featherless. They stalk their prey from the skies, lurking from a distance, as they wait for it to fall -- whether from exhaustion, or from another hunter.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with another melee weapon, or two with its longbow.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@dice 1d8 + 2}) piercing.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The centaur is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following shaman spells prepared:

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with another melee weapon.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Earthen Shield (3/Day)
entries: When a creature makes an attack against another creature within 15 feet of the centaur, the centaur can give all attacks against that creature disadvantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The centaur has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra damage die when the centaur hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a greataxe attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the centaur takes 25 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes three attacks: two with its greataxe and one with its hooves.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: War Cry (1/Day)
entries: Each creature of the centaurs choice within 30 feet of it that can hear it gains advantage on attack rolls until the start of the centaurs next turn. The centaur then makes a melee weapon attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Agile
entries: Opportunity attacks against the cheetah are made at disadvantage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The cheetah has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the cheetah moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the cheetah can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sprinter
entries: The cheetah can take the Dash action as a bonus action. When the cheetah uses the Dash action, it's speed is tripled instead of doubled.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: The chimaera has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the chimaera sleeps, one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chimaera makes two bite attacks, one of which can be replaced with one breath weapon attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.
{@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus  3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage of same type as one of the chosen breath weapons.

action.name: Breath Weapons
entries: Choose two breath weapons from the "Chimaera Breath Weapon" list.

items.name: Poison Spit {@recharge}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 30/45 ft., one creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d8}) poison damage. Hit or miss, the poison then splashes around. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage.
In addition, each creature hit by the poison must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of the chimera's next turn.

items.name: Lightning Breath {@recharge}
entries: The chimaera exhales a bolt of lighting at a creature within 30 feet of it. That creature must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. Afterwards, the bolt jumps to a second creature within 30 feet of the first target and then to a third creature within 30 feet of the second one.

items.name: Acid Breath {@recharge}
entries: The chimaera ejects acid in a 20-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC l5 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Further more, any nonmagical armor made of metal that is hit by the acid corrodes. After receiving damage, the armor takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to armor class. If its penalty drops to -5, the armor is destroyed.

items.name: Ice Jet {@recharge}
entries: The chimaera exhales a frigid beam of blue-white light forming a line 80 feet long and 5 feet wide in any direction it wants.  Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one and it becomes {@condition incapacitated} until the start of the chimaera's next turn.

items.name: Fire Breath {@recharge}
entries: The chimaera exhales fire in a 45-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed against a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage and catch fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the clefthoof moves at least 20 feet straight towards a Large or smaller creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the clefthoof can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Gore
entries: Melee Attack Weapon: {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be thrown 20 ft. into the air. On a failed save the target falls in a free space within 10 ft. from the clefthoof and suffer 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage from the fall.

action.name: Stomp
entries: Melee Attack Weapon: {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tremor {@recharge}
entries: The clefthoof stomps with extreme force, causing the ground within 10 ft. from it to become difficult terrain. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and fall {@condition prone}. A successful save results in half damage and no other effect.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 12} Consitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on successful one.

action.name: Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}The target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Spray
entries: The cobra spits venom in a 15 foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Targets that fails this save are also considered {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The core hound sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light in an additional 15 feet.

trait.name: Molten Core
entries: A creature that touches the core hound or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage. In addition, any nonmagical weapon that hits the core hound melts. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition that hits the core hound is destroyed after dealing damage.

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: The core hound has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: When one of the core hounds heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The core hound makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Molten Breath {@recharge 4}
entries: The core hound exhales searing flames in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature failing the save who wears nonmagical armor or a shield take a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The cougar has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the cougar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the cougar can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The coyote has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The coyote advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the coyote's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sing
entries: The crane starts to sing. Each creature within 20 ft. who can hear the crane and has 20 hit points or less fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. They awaken if they take any damage or if another creature takes an action to rouse them.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The crocolisk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the crocolisk can't bite another target.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The pummeler is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pummeler makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Crowd Pummel {@recharge}
entries: The pummeler slams its claws into the ground. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed saving throw, the target is knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dwarf's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the dwarf has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Blunderbuss
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 15/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dwarf's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dwarf is a 14th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The dwarf has the following mage spells prepared:
footerEntries: {@i The dwarf casts {@spell fire shield} on itself before combat.}

trait.name: Forged in Flames
entries: Any melee weapon the dwarf wields deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the dwarf has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dwarf makes two warhammer attacks.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Conjure Fire Elemental (1/Day)
entries: The dwarf magically conjures a fire elemental. The fire elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its conjurer, and acts as an ally of its conjurer. It remains for 10 minutes, or until it dies.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the hound moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Dc 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The hound sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light in an additional 10 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dwarf's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Forged in Flames
entries: Any melee weapon the dwarf wields deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the dwarf has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dwarf makes three battleaxe attacks, or two blunderbuss attacks and uses Call to Attack.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Blunderbuss
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 15/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Call to Attack
entries: Up to three allied dark iron dwarves within 120 feet of this dwarf that can hear it can each use their reaction to make one weapon attack.

reaction.name: Hateful Command
entries: When an ally that the dwarf can see makes a {@dice d20} roll, the dwarf can roll a {@dice d6} and the ally can add the number rolled to the {@dice d20} roll by taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage. A creature immune to psychic damage can't be affected by Hateful Command.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dwarf's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dwarf is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The dwarf has the following mage spells prepared:

trait.name: Forged in Flames
entries: Any melee weapon the dwarf wields deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the dwarf has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Summon Darkhound (1/Day)
entries: The dwarf magically summons a pair of darkhounds. The darkhounds appears in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the summoner, and acts as an ally of its summoner. They remain for 10 minutes, until they die, or until the summoner dismisses them as an action.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The darkhound has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Otherworldly Perception
entries: The darkhound can sense the presence of any creature within 30 feet of it that is {@condition invisible} or on the Ethereal Plane. It can pinpoint such a creature that is moving.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

A {@b darkhound} is a cursed doglike creature found stalking the forests of the world, either by themselves or in small packs. Most consider them to be little more than a nuisance to be rid of, though the dark iron dwarves have found good use in them as patrol animals.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Forest Walk
entries: The dryad ignores difficult terrain in forests.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The dryad can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Poison Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. The target must succeed against a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for one minute.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Death Knight
languages: the languages it knew in life.

trait.name: Cursed air
entries: Any creature that isn't undead or a construct within 10 feet of the death knight is unable to regain hit points.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The death knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The death knight's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The death knight makes two longsword attacks and then uses *Death Coil*.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Death Coil
entries: The death knight fires a blast of unholy energy at a living or undead creature within 120 ft. A living creature has to make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 35 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. An undead creature don't get to save, but instead of taking damage it restores 35 ({@dice 10d6}) hit points.

action.name: Intimidating Shout. (1/Day)
entries: The death knight lets out a horrifying cry and all creatures withing 30 ft. have to make a {@dc 17} wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} as it can do nothing else but cowering in fear. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Raise Dead {@recharge 5}
