entries: The death knight animates a non-undead, non-construct, medium or larger corpse within 60 ft. A bone golem appears in the space of the corpse and the corpse is destroyed. The bone golem then rolls for initiative acting on its turn as normal.

reaction.name: Hysteria
entries: When an undead creature the deathknight can see makes an attack roll, the death knight can utter maddening words to it. The creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and has advantage on all attack rolls it makes until the end of its turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The revenant's spellcating ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}) and casts as a 17th level spellcaster. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the revenant to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the revenant drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The revenant's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The revenant makes three scythe attacks.

action.name: Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Death Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: The revenant makes one scythe attack. If the attack hits, it deals an extra 42 ({@damage 12d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the revenant's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The revenant can have no more than twenty zombies under its control at one time.

monster.name: Deathcharger
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Icy Hooves
entries: The deathcharger freezes the ground where it touches it, allowing it to walk over any liquid surfaces.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the deathcharger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the deathcharger can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Wraith Walk
entries: The Deathcharger and its rider magically enter the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

Greater Steed Variant: Deathknights can summon a deathcharger via the {@spell find greater steed} spell. When a deathcharger is summoned through the spell it loses the extra attack from {b {@i trampleing charge}} when a target is {@condition prone}, also its {@b {@i wraith walk}} ability can only be used 3 times per long rest and only lasts until the start of its next turn.

variant.name: Greater Steed
entries: The Deathcharger and its rider magically enter the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

Greater Steed Variant: Deathknights can summon a deathcharger via the {@spell find greater steed} spell. When a deathcharger is summoned through the spell it loses the extra attack from {b {@i trampleing charge}} when a target is {@condition prone}, also its {@b {@i wraith walk}} ability can only be used 3 times per long rest and only lasts until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The devilsaur makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +10 to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}39 ({@damage 5d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) . Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the devilsaur can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} +10 to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the devilsaur and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Maim
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the devilsaur's bite takes 59 ({@damage 8d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If this reduces the creature to 0 hp, the devilsaur swallows it and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the devilsaur, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the devilsaur's turns.

If the Devilsaur takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from creatures inside it, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of it. If the devilsaur dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by him and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the devilsaur king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Trample
entries: Whenever the devilsaur moves into an area occupied by a Medium or smaller creature, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The devilsaur king makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +14 to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}39 ({@damage 5d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}) . Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the devilsaur king can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} +14 to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the devilsaur king and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Maim
entries: One {@condition grappled} creature takes 59 ({@damage 8d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If this reduces the creature to 0 hp, the devilsaur swallows it and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the devilsaur king, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the devilsaur king's turns.

If the devilsaur king takes 45 damage or more on a single turn from creatures inside it, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of it. If the devilsaur king dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Terrifying Roar
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the devilsaur king that can hear him must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The devilsaur king moves half his speed.

legendary.name: Terrifying Roar
entries: The devilsaur king uses Terrifying Roar.

legendary.name: Swallow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The devilsaur king swallows a creature it is grappling and the grapple ends.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The diemetradon can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The diemetradon makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Silencing Howl (1/Day)
entries: The diemetradon casts {@spell silence}, centered on itself.

variant.name: Incendosaur
entries: Found in regions of searing flames and flowing lava, an incendosaur is a distent relative to the diemetradon. An incendorsaur has the same statistics as a diemetradon, except it is immune to fire damage and replaces the diemetradon's silencing howl with the following action.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge {@recharge 5}).
entries: The incendosaur exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

trait.name: Berserk
entries: Whenever the troll starts its turn with 60 hit points or fewer, it must make a {@dc 11} Wisdom save. On a failed save, the troll goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the troll attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move and attack, the troll attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the troll goes berserk, it continues to dos so until its killed or regains all its hit points.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll makes three fist attacks. It then uses its toss if able.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Toss
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. The troll can't use this attack if it doesn't have a target {@condition grappled}. Both the target thrown and hit takes damage from the attack.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 50/100 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 7d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

variant.name: Dire Troll Caster
entries: The troll's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}). The troll can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

items: 2/day each: {@i {@spell bestow curse}, {@spell confusion}, {@spell command}, {@spell slow}}

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Reflective Armor Plating
entries: The direhorn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the direhorn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the direhorn can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Demon Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the doomguard's darkvision.

trait.name: Fel Weapons
entries: The doomguard's weapon attacks are magical

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The doomguard has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The doomguard makes three attacks with its scimitar. It can replace one of these weapon attacks with a stomp attack.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage.

action.name: Stomp {@recharge 5}
entries: Creatures within 15 feet must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails its save is knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Demonic Doom
entries: When a creature within 15 feet of the doomguard deals damage on the doomguard, it can inflict a curse on that creature. They must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, or have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws against demons till the end of the doomguard's next turn.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The doomlord's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with > spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Demon Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the doomlord's darkvision.

trait.name: Fel Weapons
entries: The doomlord's weapon attacks are treated as if magical.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The doomlord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The doomlord makes three attacks: three with its scimitar, or two with its scimitar and one with its stomp.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage + 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Stomp {@recharge 5}
entries: Creatures within 15 feet must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails its save is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Demonic Howl
entries: Any non-fiend that hears the howl must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened}. A {@condition frightened} creature can remake the saving throw at the end of each turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to Demonic Howl for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Wing Buffet
entries: When the doomguard is attacked by a creature it can see, it can flex its wings to throw that creature away. The creature must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The doomskull is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It requires no somatic or material components to cast its spells. The doomskull has the following mage and warlock spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The doomskull has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Swift caster
entries: The doomskull can use a bonus action to cast a cantrip, even if it casts a spell using its action.

trait.name: Vacant Size
entries: The doomskull can occupy another creature's space and vice versa.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Curse of Doom
entries: When the doomskull is reduced to 0 hit points from taking damage caused by another creature, it utters some incomprehensible words to curse the creature with doom. The creature has to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} and become cursed. While cursed the creature cannot reduce its {@condition exhaustion} level. Undead and constructs are immune to the curse.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon turtle can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Slow and Steady
entries: The dragon turtle's speed is not reduced from pushing, dragging, or lifting more than its carrying capacity.

trait.name: Stable
entries: Whenever an effect knocks the turtle {@condition prone}, it can make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}. A {@condition prone} turtle is upside down. To stand up, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity check on its turn and then use all its movement for that turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shell Defense
entries: The turtle withdraws itself into its shell. Until it emerges it gain +4 bonus to AC and has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in its shell, it is {@condition prone}, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexerity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge from its shell.

Wild {b dragon turtles} are vicious, with sharp jaws and a nasty temper. When domesticated however, they make ideal rides for the pandaren, able to carry heavy loads (a necessity for any pandaren mount) with an even gait that can lull them into any easy sleep.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The dragonhawk has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the dragonhawk is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragonhawk makes two attacks with its talons.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragonhawk exhales fire  in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Dread Lord
languages: Eredun; the dread lord can understand any physical language and communicate with any creature that speaks one

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dread lord is a 12th-level spellcaster. The dread lord's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). The dread lord has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Demonic Terror
entries: Any non-demonic creature who sees the dread lord must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition frightened} of the dread lord, and must repeat the saving throw at the start of each turn. A creature who succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dread lord fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Vampiric Aura
entries: Whenever the dread lord or allies within 30 feet of it deal necrotic damage, they regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dread lord makes two vampiric claw attacks.

action.name: Vampiric Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Charm
entries: The dread lord targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of itself. If the target can see the dread lord, the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed}. The {@condition charmed} target regards the nathrezim as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. The target isn't under the dread lord's control, but it takes the dread lord's requests and action in the most favorable way.

Each time the dread lord or its companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect last 24 hours or until the dread lord is destroyed, is on a different place of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end this effect.

action.name: Carrion Swarm {@recharge 5}
entries: The dread lord summons a swarm of biting insects around himself. All creatures in a 30 foot line starting from the dread lord must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage and 14 necrotic damage , or half as much on a successful save. A creature who fails this saving throw also can only take either their action or bonus action on their turn, not both for 1 minute, or until they succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, which can be made at the end of each of their turns.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The dread lord can move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The dread lord makes one vampiric claw attack.

legendary.name: Sleep (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The nathrezim cast *sleep* using one of its spell slots.

trait.name: Forest Walk
entries: The dryad ignores difficult terrain in forests.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The dryad can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Poison Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. The target must succeed against a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for one minute.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two attacks: one with its slam and one with its gust.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Gust
entries: One target must make a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 7 ({@dice 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and is flung up to 20 feet directly away from the elemental and knocked {@condition prone}. If the saving throw is successful, the target only takes half damage and isn't flung away or knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Upheaval {@recharge 4}
entries: The elemental pushes dust upwards at a point it can see within 15 feet of it. Each creature other than the elemental within 5 feet of the upheaval must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the elemental's next turn. The elemental needs loose earth, rock, or something similar to use upheaval.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The eagle has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The revenant's spellcating ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals two extra dice of damage when the revenant hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The revenant's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The revenant deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The revenant makes two club attacks.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 3d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Heavy Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: The revenant makes one club attack. On a hit, the target takes an extra 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked back up to 20 feet and fall {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the elekk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the elekk can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

The great {@b elekks} are among the oldest living species on Draenor. These trunked creatures move in herds and while generally peaceful as long as their young and water supply are unthreatened, can use their four tusks to deadly effect. The draenei have been known to use them as beasts of burden, using Light-infused crystals to render them more docile.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eredar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Dread Crush
entries: If the eredar brute moves at least 20 feet in a straight line toward a creature, it can use its bonus action to leap up to 10 feet toward a direction and make a burning claws attack against a creature in range. If it hits, the creature must succeed against a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or that creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of the eredar brute's next turn.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The eredar brute has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eredar brute makes two Burning Claw attacks.

action.name: Burning Claws
entries: {@atk mw} +X to hit, 10 feet, one target: 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Overpowering Flurries {@recharge 5}
entries: The Eredar Brute uses its Multiattack, but on a hit, it deals the fire damage of its Burning Claw to all creatures within 5 feet of the creature it hit.
Reaction

action.name: Enrage
entries: When the eredar brute suffers from a critical hit, or falls below half its hit point maximum, it can enrage as a reaction, gaining 20 temporary hit points. While it possesses these temporary hit points, its movement speed increases by 10 feet and it deals additional fire damage with weapon attacks equal to its Charisma modifier.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eredar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the doommaiden is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage to the target

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Doommaiden makes two melee attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with her Fel Bulwark action.

action.name: Fel Bulwark
entries: One fiend within 30 feet of the doommaiden is bolsters. That creature gains 20 temporary hit points, and while it has these hit points, the creature gains a bonus to saving throws equal to the doommaiden's Charisma modifier.

action.name: Felclaws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage, and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. The doomaiden can alternatively choose not do the slashing damage to instead grapple the creature (escape DC XX).

action.name: Shadow Rend
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is magically cursed for 1 hour. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on all ability checks, and whenever that creature takes damage, they take an additional {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Fel Backdraft {@recharge 5}
entries: When the eredar doommaiden is hit, it can use it reaction to force all creatures within 10 feet of it to make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, or be knocked back 5 feet and knocked {@condition prone}. It can then move up to half its fly speed.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eredar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eredar is a 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Dread Presence
entries: Demon's within 30 feet of the eredar lord gain a bonus to their Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws equal to the eredar lord's Charisma modifier. In addition, non-fiend creatures within 30 feet of the eredar lord gain a penalty to saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} equal to the eredar lord's Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance
entries: If the eredar lord would fail a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The eredar lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Creature Name makes Number and type of attacks

action.name: Felclaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage, If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the creature is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until the grapple ends, the eredar can't use this claw on another target. The eredar has two claws.

action.name: Summon Infernal (Recharge on a Long Rest)
entries: The eredar lord calls down an meteor from the sky to a space it can see within 60 feet. All creatures within 15 feet of this space must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

In addition, an *infernal* appears in the same space. It rolls its own initiative, is friendly to the eredar lord and its allies. This infernal last for 1 minute or until the eredar lord is dropped to 0 hit points.

legendary.name: Felclaw
entries: The eredar lord makes one felclaw attack

legendary.name: Command Demons (Cost 2 Actions)
entries: The eredar lord commands all demons within 15 feet of it to attack using their reaction.

legendary.name: Cantrip (Cost 2 Actions)
entries: The eredar cast one of its cantrips.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eredar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eredar is a 14th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting modifier is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16} , {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It has the following warlock spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The eredar warlock has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, 10 feet, one target: 6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) piercing damage.
Reaction

action.name: Power Drain {@recharge 5}
entries: When the eredar warlock succeeds on a saving throw against a spell, it can use its reaction to force the caster of the spell to make a Charisma saving throw against its spell DC. On a failed save, the eredar warlock regains one expended spell slot, and the caster can't cast spells other than cantrips for 1 minute.

monster.name: Eye of Kilrogg
languages: can understand Eredun but can't speak it.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eye of kilrogg's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The eye of kilrogg has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Fel Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Focused Eye
entries: The eye focuses its negative energy onto a creature it can see; until the start of the eye's next turn, if that creature is affected by a spell and makes a saving throw as to end that spell's effects, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The faerie dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The faerie dragon makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Mana Flare (1/Day)
entries: The faerie dragon channels magical energies that damage foes when they cast spells near it. Until the end of it's next turn, whenever an enemy within 30 ft from the faerie dragon casts a spell, that creature needs to succeed a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 3 ({@dice 1d6}) points of damage per level of the spell it cast.
In addition, if the dragon succeeds on a saving throw against an enemies spell, mana flare automatically recharges.

reaction.name: Phase Shift {@recharge 5}
entries: Whenever the fairie dragon takes damage, it can use its reaction to immediately become incorporeal until its next turn. While incorporeal, it cannot attack, move or take any actions and it remains visible as a ghostly outline.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the fel lord hits with it.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the fel lord moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Legion Axe attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Legion Strike
entries: Once on each of its turns when the fel lord make a Legion Axe attack, it can make another attack against a different creature that is within 5 feet of both the first creature and the fel lord.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fel lord makes two weapon attacks. He can replace one weapon attack with Earth Tremor.

action.name: Legion Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Earth Tremor {@recharge 5}
entries: You slam your weapon into the ground causing a tremor out to 10 feet. Each creature other than you in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) thunder damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. If the ground in that area is loose earth or stone, it becomes difficult terrain until cleared, with each 5-foot-diameter portion requiring at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

reaction.name: Pursuit
entries: When a creature attempts to move out of the fel lord's weapon range, it can use its reaction to move up to its movement speed toward the creature and make a weapon attack. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

resist.note: from non-magical attacks that aren't adamantine.

trait.name: Fel Weapons
entries: The fel reaver's melee attacks are magical, and deal and additional {@damage 2d8} fire damage, on a hit (included in the attack). This fire damage ignores resistance and treats immunity as resistance.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The fel reaver is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Frightening Presence
entries: Each hostile creature within 120 feet of the fel reaver and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effects ends on it, the creature is immune to the fel reaver's Frightening Presence for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The fel reaver deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Quiet Exhaust
entries: The fel reaver, despite its size and bulk, is surprisingly quiet. Creatures that have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing do not apply it against the fel reaver.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fel reaver makes one slam attack, and one stomp attack (if applicable).

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 feet., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage, and the creature is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 feet, one target. {@h}34 ({@dice 4d12 + 9}) bludgeoning daamge plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: War Stomp {@recharge 5}
entries: The fel reaver slams down into the ground repeatedly. All other creatures on the ground within 30 feet of the fel reaver must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature who is {@condition prone} and fails the save is also {@condition stunned} for 1 minute, and can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns.
Reaction

action.name: Mechanical Screech
entries: When the fel reaver takes a critical hit, it releases a terrifying metallic sound, forcing all creatures to be affected by its Frightening Presence until the start of its next turn, even if they are immune to it. If a creature is already {@condition frightened} from this ability and fails the save, it it also {@condition paralyzed}. If a creature would be immune to the fel reaver's Frightening Presence, it makes the saving throw with advantage.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the felbat has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The bat can't use its Blindsight while Deafened.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The bat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The felbat makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fel Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d12}) fire damage.

action.name: Demonic Scream
entries: The felbat releases a shrill scream to instill fear into their enemies. All creatures except fiends that can hear the felbat within 60 feet must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw, being {@condition frightened} on a failed save for a minute. An affected creature can remake the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect and becoming immune to the felbat's Demonic Scream for the next 24 hours on a succesful save.

trait.name: Legion Strike
entries: Once on each of its turns when the felguard make a Legion Axe attack, it can make another attack against a different creature that is within 5 feet of both the first creature and the felguard.

trait.name: Strength of the Legion
entries: The felguard has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if one of the felguard's allies attacked the creature since the end of its last turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Felguard can make two greataxe attacks

action.name: Legion Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Pursuit
entries: When a creature attempts to move out of the felguard's weapon range, it can use its reaction to move up to its movement speed toward the creature and make a weapon attack. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Mage Slayer
entries: A creature dealt damage by the felhunter has disadvantage on Constituion saving throws made to maintain {@status concentration} on a spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The felhound has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: The felhound can sense magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise work like the {@spell detect magic} spell but isn't itself magical

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) piercing damage against a {@condition grappled} target.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: The felhound lashes out with its tentacles at a creature within 5 feet. The target must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} and take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage. The felhound regains hit points equal to half the necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Devour Magic
entries: When a creature cast a spell, the felhunter can makes an Intelligence check against a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell ends and the felhound regains {@dice 1d8} hit points per spell level.

trait.name: Mage Slayer
entries: A creature dealt damage by the felhunter has disadvantage on Constituion saving throws made to maintain {@status concentration} on a spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The felhound has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The felstalker has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the felstalker's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: The felhound can sense magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise work like the *detect magic* spell but isn't itself magical

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be afflicted by Fel Disease.

A target afflicted by Fel Disease takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage at the start of each turn. The felstalker that inflicted this disease on the target regains hit points equal to half the necrotic damage. A target can only be inflicted with Fel Disease from one source. The target can repeat its saving throw at the end of each round to end the effect, or the affliction can be removed by any effect which cures diseases or dispels magic.

reaction.name: Devour Magic
entries: When a creature cast a spell, the felhunter can makes an Intelligence check against a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell ends and the felhound regains {@dice 1d8} hit points per spell level.

monster.name: Felsteed
languages: understands Eredun and Common but can't speak

trait.name: Confer Fire Resistance
entries: The felsteed can grant resistance to fire damage to anyone riding it.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The felsteed sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. >

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the felsteed moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the horse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage + 7({@dice 2d6}) fire damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks and weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The worgen has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on its hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The worgen has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the worgen's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The worgen's long jump is up to 30 ft. and its high jump is up to 20 ft., with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The worgen makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or gain the {@reward worgen curse}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The revenant's spellcating ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks) and casts as a 17th level spellcaster. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: A creature that touches the revenant or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The revenant's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The revenant makes three longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Molten Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: The revenant makes one longsword attack. On a hit, the target takes an additional 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage. If the target wears non magical armor or a shield, it takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed.

monster.name: Flesh Giant

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Fear of Fire
entries: When the flesh giant takes fire damage, it has to make a wisdom saving throw. The DC equals 10 or half the damage it takes, whichever number is higher. On a failure the flesh giant has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The flesh giant is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flesh giant can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes two fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the flesh giant's choice that is within 120 feet of the flesh giant and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the flesh giant's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Stomp {@recharge 5}
entries: The flesh giant stomps the ground knocking any creature and unsecured object into the air. Each creature within 50 yards of the stone giant must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 10d8}) bludgeoning damage and be hurled 20 feet into the air, immediately falling if it cannot hover. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and is not hurled into the air. Unsecure objects are automatically hurled into the air.

reaction.name: Acid Spinal Fluid
entries: When hit by a melee attack that deals slashing or piercing damage to the flesh giant, it spews corrosive acid over its attacker. The attacker have to make a {@dc 17} dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid damage.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While attached to a creature, the fleshbeast takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down), and that creature takes the other half.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fleshbeast makes two attacks: one with its tentacle and one with its bite. If attached it makes two bite attacks against the creature it is attached to instead.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Small or larger, the fleshbeast attaches to it, moving into its space which is shared with the target. The fleshbeast's movement speed becomes 0 and it gains advantage on bite attacks against the target. In addition, at the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage and if the target moves the fleshbeast moves with it. The fleshbeast can detach itself as a bonus action, in which case it regains its movement speed and needs to spend that movement speed to move out of the target's space. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the fleshbeast by succeeding on a {@dc 14} Strength check.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 3 ({@dice 1d6}) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured. A swarm of insect's crawl out of a creature {@dice 1d4} rounds after it died if it was diseased upon its death.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has three heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Vile Blood
entries: Whenever the hydra takes piercing or slashing damage, its blood sprays the attacker, dealing 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.
{@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon
entries: Choose the breath weapon from the "Hydra Breath Weapon" list.

items.name: Rolling Bile {@recharge 5}
entries: The hydra spews a ball of putrid bile at a point within 20 feet from it. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Crackling Thunder {@recharge 5}
entries: The hydra spews bolts of lighting in a 15-foot cone. Every creature must succeed against a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage and it cannot use its reactions until the start of hydra's next turn.

items.name: Ball of Fire {@recharge 5}
entries: The hydra spews a large ball of fire at a point within 15 feet from it. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners. It lasts for 10 minute. When a creature enters the burning area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The fox has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The fox can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The frenzyfish has advantage on melee attacks against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The frenzyfish can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The frog can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The frog's long jump is up to 10 feet and its high jump is up to 5 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The wolf has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Frost Aura
entries: A creature who ends their turn within 15 feet of the dragon or strikes it with a melee attack takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magical Ice
entries: Creatures killed by a frostbrood dragon's cold become a frozen statue until they thaw.
Ice made by frost wyrms is magical and will not melt without magical assistance.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Sweep
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., all targets in reach. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Frost Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw has their movement speed halved and can't take reactions for 1 minute. If they fail their save by 5 or more, they are also entombed in ice.

While entombed, they have total cover and are {@condition restrained} and {@condition incapacitated}. At the beginning of their turn, they take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage and can attempt a {@dc 18} Strength check, breaking free from the ice on a success. The ice can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp equal to cold damage taken by the breath weapon; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to cold, poison, and psychic damage).

legendary.name: Icy Grip
entries: Each creature within 40 feet of the dragon must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pulled to the closest unoccupied space next to the dragon.

legendary.name: Sleet Storm
entries: The dragon casts *sleet storm*.

legendary.name: Ice Tomb (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: A creature the dragon can see within 60 feet must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or become entombed in ice, as if they were affected by Frost Breath (30 hit points). On a successful save, they instead have their speed halved and cannot take reactions until the dragon's next turn.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drake's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Frost Aura

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The drake can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drake makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Frost Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The drake exhales an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 7d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw has their movement speed halved and can't take reactions for 1 minute. If they fail their save by 5 or more, they are also entombed in ice.

While entombed, they have total cover and are {@condition restrained} and {@condition incapacitated}. At the beginning of their turn, they take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage and can attempt a {@dc 16} Strength check, breaking free from the ice on a success. The ice can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp equal to cold damage taken by the breath weapon; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to cold, poison, and psychic damage).

trait.name: Frost Aura
entries: A creature who ends their turn within 5 feet of the whelp or strikes it with a melee attack takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

trait.name: Magical Ice
entries: Creatures killed by a frostbrood dragon's cold become a frozen statue until they thaw.
Ice made by frost wyrms is magical and will not melt without magical assistance.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The whelp can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Frost Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The whelp exhales an icy blast in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw has their movement speed halved and can't take reactions for 1 minute.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wyrm's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Frost Aura
entries: A creature who ends their turn within 20 feet of the wyrm or strikes it with a melee attack takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The wyrm can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the wyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magical Ice
entries: Creatures killed by a frostbrood dragon's cold become a frozen statue until they thaw.
Ice made by frost wyrms is magical and will not melt without magical assistance.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wyrm can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Sweep
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., all targets in reach. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the wyrm's choice that is within 120 feet of the wyrm and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the wyrm's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Frost Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The wyrm exhales an icy blast in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 52 ({@damage 12d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw has their movement speed halved and can't take reactions for 1 minute. If they fail their save by 5 or more, they are also entombed in ice.

While entombed, they have total cover and are {@condition restrained} and {@condition incapacitated}. At the beginning of their turn, they take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage and can attempt a {@dc 22} Strength check, breaking free from the ice on a success. The ice can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp equal to cold damage taken by the breath weapon; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to cold, poison, and psychic damage).

legendary.name: Icy Grip
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the wyrm must make a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or be pulled to the closest unoccupied space next to the dragon.

legendary.name: Sleet Storm
entries: The wyrm casts *sleet storm*.

legendary.name: Ice Tomb (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: A creature the wyrm can see within 60 feet must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or become entombed in ice, as if they were affected by Frost Breath (50 hit points). On a successful save, they instead have their speed halved and cannot take reactions until the dragon's next turn.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The wyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the wyrm must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The wyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Breath Weapon (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The wyrm uses its breath weapon, if it is available.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The furbolg's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). The furbolg can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Wounded Fury
entries: While it has 10 hit points or fewer, the furbolg has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The furbolg makes two claw attacks, or one with its claws and one with its quarterstaff.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

variant.name: Furbolg Shaman
entries: Some furbolgs devote themselves to becoming a shaman for their tribe. A furbolg shaman has a challenge rating of 3 (700 XP) and gains the Spellcasting trait.

entries.name: Spellcasting.
entries: The furbolg is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following shaman spells prepared:

items: 1st level (4 slots): {@i {@spell chromatic orb}, {@spell cure wounds}, {@spell fog cloud}, {@spell thunderwave}}
2nd level (2 slots): {@i {@spell heat metal}, {@spell lesser restoration}}

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The furbolg's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). The furbolg can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The furbolg is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following shaman spells

trait.name: Wounded Fury
entries: While it has 10 hit points or fewer, the furbolg has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The furbolg makes two claw attacks, or one with its claws and one with its quarterstaff.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has three heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.
{@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) cold damage.

action.name: Arctic Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 30/45 ft., one creature. {@h}44 ({@damage 8d10}) cold damage. In addition, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, or become {@condition restrained}.
At the beginning of their turn, they can attempt a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw to end the effect on a success.

action.name: Wrench
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Cache of Weapons
entries: The gan'arg uses one of the following options (roll a {@dice d6} or choose one); the gan'arg can use each one no more than once per day:

items.name: 1. High Explosive Sheep
items.entry: The gan'arg releases a mechanized sheep into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. the sheep has a walking speed of 20 feet, AC 10, 1 hit point, and no effective attacks. It rolls initiative, and on its turn, moves toward the closest creature, preferably toward a group of creature. It then proceeds to explode, forcing all creatures within 10 feet of it to make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 1d6} fire damage and being knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and no other ill effect on a success.

items.name: 2. Mana Bomb
items.entry: The gan'arg throws a mana bomb within 30 feet of it, and every creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, or lose {@dice 1d4} level of spell slots, starting with the lowest spell slot available, and taking {@damage 1d4} damage per level of slot lost. Slots lost in this way are regained upon finishin a short or long rest.

items.name: 3. Goblin Dragon Gun
items.entry: All creature in a 10 foot cone in front of the gan'arg must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 1d4} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature who fails the saving is also set {@condition ablaze|TEB} 1 minute, taking {@damage 1d4} fire damage at the end of each of their turns, unless they succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw to put it out.

items.name: 4. Rocket Launcher
items.entry: The gan'arg shoots a rocket. Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit 4} to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage, and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition incapacitated} till the start of the gan'arg's next turn.

items.name: 5. Recombobulate
items.entry: The gan'arg uses a recombobulating chicken on one of its allies, ending one condition on it and restoring {@dice 1d6 + 2} hit points.

items.name: 6. Magnetic Bomb
entries: The gan'arg throws a magnetic bomb within 30 feet of itself, forcing all creatures either wearing metal armor or wielding metal weapons within 15 feet of it to make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pulled 10 feet toward the bomb if its wearing metal armor, or loses its weapon as its pulled toward the bomb if wielding a metallic weapon.

resist.note: slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gargoyle makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stone Form
entries: The gargoyle turns itself to stone making it indistinguishable from an inanimate statue. While it is turned this way, the gargoyle can't take any actions or move, and regains 5 hit points at the end of each of its turns. The gargoyle can turn itself into flesh using its bonus action.

monster.name: Geist
languages: the languages it knew in life.

trait.name: Hangman's Rope
entries: The geist has disadvantage on ability checks to contest or escape a grapple.

trait.name: One Eyed
entries: The geist has disadvantage on perception checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The geist's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start. If the geist jumps atleast 15 feet towards a creature, it has advantage on its next attack against the creature until the end of its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The geist makes three claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghost can see 60 ft. into the Spirit World when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ghost makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the ghost can utter a special command or warning whenever a non-hostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the ghost. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The ghost enters the Spirit World from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Spirit World, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The ghost adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghost can see 60 ft. into the Spirit World when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The ghost deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the ghost that isn't incapacitated and the ghost doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ghost makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 (ld6 +3) piercing damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The ghost enters the Spirit World from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Spirit World, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Cannibalize (Recharge after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The ghoul cannibalizes the corpse of a humanoid that has been dead for less than a day, regaining 10 hit points. Each creature of the ghoul's choice that is within 30 feet of the ghoul and can see it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any ghoul's cannibalize for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 50/100 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 7d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The bat can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The bat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bat makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Screech
entries: The bat lets out a sonic blast in a 15-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 10} Constitution save or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage, or half as much on a successful save.

The Forsaken make good use of {b giant bats} as aerial mounts, using them as scouts and as platforms to drop vials of plague upon their enemies. In the wild, they are most often seen in the Plaguelands, drawn to the carrion stench of the region.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the bear moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the bear can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The bear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
