A falcosaur of the sharptalon tribe has the additional trait:

entries.name: Veridian Hide
entries: The sharptalon falcosaur has advantage on hiding in forests and woodlands.

items.name: Snowfeather
entries: Snowfeather falcosaur are the most predatory of all known falcosaur species while being particularly fond of large prey. Their hide and fur allow them to hide in fog and fog banks.
A falcosaur of the snowfeather tribe has the additional trait:

entries.name: Snowfeather Hide
entries: The snowfeather falcosaur has advantage on hiding in fog or snow.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The ravager has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Swarming
entries: The ravager can move through a hostile creature's space even if the creature isn't two sizes larger or smaller than the ravager.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. If the target is wearing armor and the attack roll exceeds the target's AC by 5 or more, the target's armor takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 is destroyed.

trait.name: Brood's Courage
entries: The ravager and allied creatures within 30 feet that can see or hear the ravager has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The ravager has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ravager makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. If the target is wearing armor and the attack roll exceeds the target's AC by 5 or more, the target's armor takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 is destroyed.

action.name: Distress Call {@recharge}
entries: The ravager makes a deafening screech, each creature within 20 feet of it that can hear it and that isn't a ravager must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. The screech can be heard within 240 feet of the ravager, altering the brood of danger.

action.name: Stunning Screech (1/Day)
entries: The ravager emits a horrific screech. Each creature within 20 feet of it that can hear it and that isn't a ravager must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the ravager's next turn.

reaction.name: Brood's Protection
entries: When a creature the ravager can see targets it with an attack, the ravager can choose another ravager within 5 feet of it. The chosen ravager uses its reaction to protect the brood mother, becoming the new target of the attack.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The ravager doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Swarming
entries: The ravager can move through a hostile creature's space even if the creature isn't two sizes larger or smaller than the ravager.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the rhino moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the riverbeast moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The riverbeast can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

trait.name: Underwater Camouflage
entries: The riverbeast has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made while underwater.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

{@b Riverbeasts} are great aquatic beasts of Draenor, possessing a rocky plates, a club-like tail, and long lower tusks. While they appear docile at a distance, they are known to be one of the most easily provoked and deadly animals on the planet. Azeroth possess its own variety of riverbeast, though their skin is smooth and they lack the prominent tails of their cousins.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: While out of water, the zoatroid can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The zoatroid can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The zoatroid has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until the grapple ends, the zoatroid shares space with it, the target is {@condition blinded}, and the zoatroid can't use its tentacles on another target without ending the grapple.

action.name: Dominate {@recharge}
entries: One humanoid {@condition grappled} by the zoatroid must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be dominated by the zoatroid: the dominated target goes on the zoatroids initiative, it controls the target using its action. The {@i Dominate} deprives the target of its vision but not its awareness. The royal zoatroid can be targeted by attacks, spells, and other effects but any attack roll that misses the zoatroid automatically hits its dominated target.
The domination lasts until the target drops to 0 hit points, the zoatroid ends it as a bonus action, or a creature uses their action to attempt a grapple check contested by the zoatroid.

action.name: Fogged Mind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Each non-aberration creature within 10 feet of the zoatroid must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

reaction.name: Reactive Shield
entries: The zoatroid forces an attack roll that would hit it to instead hit its enslaved target. To do so, the zoatroid must be able to see the attacker.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The sabercat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the sabercat moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the sabercat can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

If the target is {@condition prone}, the sabertusk can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Tendon Rip
entries: If the sabertusk hits the same creature with two claw attacks in the same turn, the creature takes another 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Shadowmeld
entries: The satyr can attempt to hide even when it is only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, or other natural phenomena.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Scimitar

action.name: Shortbow

trait.name: Fiendish Blessing
entries: While the satyr is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Shadowmeld

action.name: Scimitar

spellcasting.name: Innate spellcasting
headerEntries: The satyr's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: The satyr can use its bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Shadowmeld
entries: The satyr can attempt to hide even when it is only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, or other natural phenomena.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)

action.name: Multiattack

trait.name: Keen Smell

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The saurid has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the saurid's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Attack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 3d4}) poison damage and be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

monster.name: Scourge Risen Knight
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The shade can move through a spade as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the shade can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries: While in sunlight, the shade has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Wisdom Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) necrotic damage, and the target's Wisdom score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. If the target's Wisdom score is reduced to 0, it is paralyzed until it regains at least one point of Wisdom.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The shade magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, or until its {@status concentration} is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell)

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The spider can burrow through nonmagical unworked earth and stone. While doing so, it doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spider makes two attacks: one with its bite and one slam.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The shivarra has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Fel Weapons
entries: the shivarra'sweapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The shivarra can take one reaction on every turn in combat.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shivarra can make up to four longsword attacks

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The shivarra adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the marilthin must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the shoveltusk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

{@b Shoveltusks} are moose-like beasts of the wintry continent Northrend, living in its southeastern areas. Their tusks are used to dig up roots and their great antlers are used to establish their dominance among rival mates. They are known to be fiercely territorial of their feeding grounds.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The shredder is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shredder makes two attacks: one with its claw and one with its sawblade

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the shredder can't use its claw against another target.

action.name: Sawblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Halt!
entries: The shredder can make one claw or sawblade attack against a creature that's attempting to climb it, if hit by the sawblade, the creature must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, or fall {@condition prone} in an empty space next to the shredder.

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: The silithid can transmit simple messages and emotions to any silithid within 240 feet of it that is part of the same hive.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the silithid moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its claws on the same turn, the target takes an extra 16 ({@damage 3d10}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the silithid takes 14 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The silithid makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the silithid can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The silithid makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the silithid, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the silithid's turns.

If the silithid takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the silithid must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the silithid. If the silithid dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: The silithid can transmit simple messages and emotions to any silithid within 240 feet of it that is part of the same hive.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) piercing damage, and the larva attaches to the target. While attached, the larva doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the larva's turns, the target loses 1 ({@dice 1d4 - 1}) hit points due to blood loss.

The larva can detach itself by spending 5 feet of movement. It does so after it drains 10 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the larva.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The silithid has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: The silithid can transmit simple messages and emotions to any silithid within 240 feet of it that is part of the same hive.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The silithid can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The silithid's long jump is up to 30 ft. and its high jump is up to 15 ft., with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The silithid makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the silithid jumps at least 15 ft. as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 ft. out of the silithid's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the silithid's space.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The silithid has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: The silithid can transmit simple messages and emotions to any silithid within 240 feet of it that is part of the same hive.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The silithid doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The silithid makes two sting attacks.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Noxious Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) poison damage, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

While {@condition poisoned} this way, any non-silithid creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: The silithid can transmit simple messages and emotions to any silithid within 240 feet of it that is part of the same hive.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The silithid can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries: The silithid makes two bite attacks and uses its Adhesive Acid if it can.

action.name: Adhesive Acid {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the end of the silithid's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gorilla makes two fist attacks.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Skeleton Mage

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The skeleton is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It requires no vocal component to cast its spells. The skeleton has the following mage spells prepared:

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Skeleton Warrior
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the skeleton can deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the skeleton that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) slashing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The moth has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Arcane Interference
entries: When a spell is cast within a 10-foot radius of the moth, roll a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 1, the spell is interrupted as if by the {@spell counterspell} spell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Pulverulent Wings (1/Day)
entries: A cloud of thick powder disperses out from the moth in a 5-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the moth's next turn on a failed save.

A {@b skywisp moth} is considered a docile, insignificant beast to most. Among arcane practitioners, however, they have a notorious reputation for their curiosity and their uncanny ability to interfere with spells cast in their vicinity.
Because of this, they are often a favoured companion for any hunters whose quarry is a dangerous spellcaster.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The spectre can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. He takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if he ends his turn inside an object.

action.name: Siphon Life
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The spectre regains hit points by an amount equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Horrifying Wail
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the spectre that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success.
If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this spectre's Horrifying Wail for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the stag moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage. If the target is a creature, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the stegadon can't use its impale on another target.

entries: The swampwalker regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the swampwalker takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the swampwalker's next turn. The swampwalker dies if it starts its turn with 0 hit points.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage

trait.name: Swamp Mobility

Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the swampwalker can only make one claw attack.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The swarm has advantage on melee attacks against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny frenzyfish. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Water Breathing

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the talbuk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage. {@b Talbuks} are one of the few remaining species of the world Argus. When the draenei fled their homeworld, they brought with them these stag-like creatures, who went on to populate worlds where the draenei had sought refuge such as Draenor and Azeroth. They primarily serve as food and occasionally mounts for the people of the Exodar.
They tend to form groups of multiple does and calves under the protection of a single patriarch, who is fiercely protective of his herd.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the talbuk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 17 ({@damage 5d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Protector
entries: If a creature makes an attack against one of the talbuk's allies, the talbuk has advantage on attack rolls against that creature until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The talbuk makes two hooves attacks.

action.name: Hooves

reaction.name: Shield
entries: When a creature makes an attack against one of the talbuk's allies, the talbuk grants a +2 bonus to the wearer's AC if it is within 5 feet of the wearer.

They primarily serve as food and occasionally mounts for the people of the Exodar.
They tend to form groups of multiple does and calves under the protection of a single patriarch, who is fiercely protective of his herd.

{@b Tallstriders} are large, flightless birds, native to the plains and savannahs of central Kalimdor. There is a very clear and stubborn pride to the tallstriders, making them near impossible to domesticate and useless as beasts of burden.
Some skilled hunters and beast-handlers have mastered the art of taming a tallstrider, however. For them, the birds' strength and speed make them excellent companions for any sudden skirmish.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The tar creeper can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Tar Stench
entries: Any creature other than a tar creeper that starts its turn within 5 feet of the tar creeper must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all tar creepers for 1 hour.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The tar creeper has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

trait.name: Swamp Mobility
entries: The tar creeper ignores difficult terrain created by swamps, and can see through nonmagical mists of swamplands.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the tar creeper moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, the target takes an additional 14 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tar creeper makes two attacks with its poison claws.

action.name: Poison Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Tar Spray (1/Day)
entries: The tar creeper sprays sticky tar in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw a creature's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions.
A creature can remove the tar on itself during a short or long rest by bathing in water, alcohol, or vinegar.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the thistleshrub remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a shrub covered in thorns.

trait.name: Water Awareness
entries: The thistleshrub can sense the presence of water reservoirs up to 5 miles away, as well as water within a creature's body. It knows the general direction they're in but no their exact location.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thistleshrub makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Thorny Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is either {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) or pushed up to 10 feet away. Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the thistleshrub can only make one claw attack.

action.name: Entangling Roots {@recharge 5}
entries: Grasping thorny roots and vines sprout in a 15-foot radius centered on the thistleshrub, withering away after 1 minute. For the duration, that area is difficult terrain for non-plant creatures. In addition, each creature of the thistleshrub's choice in that area when the plants appear must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained}. While {@condition restrained} in this way, the target takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage at the start of their turn. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 14} Strength check, freeing itself or another entangled creature within reach on a success.

trait.name: Hold breath
entries: The threshadon can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The threshadon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the threshadon takes 12 points of damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The threshadon makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the lizard moves at least 20 feet straight towards a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the lizard can make one devour attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@i Hit} 24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage. A Medium or smaller target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or swallowed by the lizard. The lizard can only have one target swallowed at a time. If a target fails the saving throw while the lizard has a creature swallowed, it is {@condition grappled} instead.

A swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the lizard, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the lizard's turns.

If the lizard takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the lizard must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the lizard. If the lizard dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Lightning Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The lizard exhales a line of lightning that is 20 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 39 ({@damage 6d12}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The tiger has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

If the target is {@condition prone}, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the trogg. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the trogg is {@condition incapacitated}.

entries: At the start of its turn, the troll can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Regeneration

entries: If the troll moves at least 20 feet straight towards a target whilst taking the Dash action, it can make one melee weapon attack against it.

If the target is a Large or smaller creature with legs, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} and knocked {@condition prone}. A target can use its action to remove the bolas, ending the grapple.
