trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has three heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.
{@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Venom Spit {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 30/45 ft., one creature. {@h}54 ({@damage 12d8}) poison damage. In addition, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution  saving throw, or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of the hydra's next turn.

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Buffeting Winds
entries: Ranged attacks against the elemental have disadvantage on the attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Cyclone
entries: The elemental creates a 15-foot cube of swirling wind centered on a point within 60 feet. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a Huge or smaller creature fails the save, that creature is also pushed up to 15 feet away from the center of the cube.

action.name: Whirlwind {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature in the elemental's space must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage and is flung up to 20 feet away from the elemental in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.
If the save is successful, the target takes half the damage and isn't flung away or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Arcane Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. When the elemental enters the area of an {@spell antimagic field} spell for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the spell save DC of its spellcaster, or be {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The elemental sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light in an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Magic Absorption
entries: The elemental has advantage on saving throws versus spells and other magical effects. When it successfully saves versus a spell, it regains hit points equal to twice the spell's level.
Additionally, whenever it is subjected to force damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the force damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two touch attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Creatures hit by this attack have disadvantage on checks to maintain {@status concentration} until the beginning of their next turn.

action.name: Arcane Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The elemental erupts arcane energy at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 37 ({@damage 15d4}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Consume Magic {@recharge 5}
entries: The elemental absorbs all magic in the area. It casts *{@spell dispel magic}*, affecting each creature within 20 feet. For each spell level of spells ended this way, the elemental regains 2 hit points.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shockwave {@recharge 4}
entries: The elemental causes the ground to shake and crack in a 30-foot-radius circle, turning it into difficult terrain. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity save or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. A successful save results in half damage and no other effect.

monster.name: Unbound Fel Elemental
languages: understands Eredun but does not speak

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the elemental can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Fel Flames
entries: Fire damage that the elemental deals ignores other creatures' fire resistance and immunity.

trait.name: Heat Aura
entries: A creature that hits the elemental with a melee attack while within 10 feet of the elemental or ends their turn there takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The elemental sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light in an additional 60 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: Melee Weapon Attack. {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) fire damage.

action.name: Fel Fireball {@recharge 5}
entries: The elemental creates a blast of green flame at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. The elemental is immune to its own attack.
Creatures who fail their save have their protections against flame stripped away, gaining vulnerability to fire damage until the beginning of the elemental's next turn.

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 10 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The elemental sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light in an additional 60 feet.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two touch attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of its turn.

action.name: Fire Storm {@recharge 5}
entries: The elemental creates a whirlwind of flame from its body, dealing 16 ({@damage 3d10}) fire damage to all creatures within 30 feet, or half damage on a successful {@dc 16} Dexterity save. This ability sets fire to flammable objects, and creatures that take any damage are ignited, taking 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of their turns until they take an action to put out the flame.

trait.name: Frost Aura
entries: The ground in a 10-foot radius around the elemental is icy and is difficult terrain. The radius moves with the elemental.

trait.name: Frost Form
entries: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical unworked ice and snow. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 10 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage. Additionally, the elemental freezes non-creature liquids within a 10-foot radius of it. A creature caught in the liquid when the elemental freezes it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}).

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The elemental can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost extra movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam or icicle attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Icicle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d12}) piercing damage.

action.name: Freezing Nova {@recharge 5}
entries: A 30-foot radius of icy air blasts from the ice elemental. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails its save against this effect has its speed halved until the start of the elemental's next turn.

trait.name: Water Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Freeze
entries: If the elemental takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Whirlpool {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the elemental must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw. On a failure, they are pulled into the elemental's space, or as close as possible. Each creature that is in the elemental's space takes 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If it is Huge or smaller, it is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the elemental's space.

The elemental can grapple one Huge creature or up to two Large or 4 Medium or smaller creatures at one time. At the start of each of the elemental's turns, each target {@condition grappled} by it takes 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. A creature within 5 feet of the elemental can pull a creature or object out of it by taking an action to make a {@dc 17} Strength and succeeding.

trait.name: Darkness
entries: Magical darkness spreads from the unforgiven in a 15-foot-radius sphere. The darkness spreads around corners. Nonmagical light can't illuminate it, but a creature with darkvision can see through it.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The unforgiven's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Telepathy
entries: The unforgiven can magically transmit messages and images to any creature within 120 feet of it that can understand a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The unforgiven makes a scythe attack and then uses *Death Coil*.

action.name: Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Death Coil
entries: The unforgiven fires a blast of unholy energy at a living or undead creature. A living creature has to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. An undead creature restores 21 ({@dice 6d6}) hit points instead.

action.name: Raise Dead {@recharge 5}
entries: The unforgiven animates a non-undead, non-construct corpse within 60 ft. A {@creature ghoul|WC5E MoM} appears in the space of the corpse and the corpse is destroyed. The {@creature ghoul|WC5E MoM} then rolls for initiative acting on its turn as normal.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The grell's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The grell can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: the vilefiend has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the vilefiend moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the vilefiend can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Vile Rupture
entries: When the vilefiend dies, it erupts with a burst of acidic liquid. Each creature within 5 feet of the vilefiend must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: the vilefiend has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the vilefiend's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated} .

action.name: Corrosive Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and a creature hit must make a {@dc 15} Con saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) acid damage on a fail. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces it AC to 10.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@dice 2d6 + 3} ) slashing damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the warhorse moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the warhorse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The revenant's spellcating ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks) and casts as a 17th level spellcaster. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The revenant's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The revenant makes three scimitar attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Tidal Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: The makes one scimitar attack. On a hit, the target takes an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage and has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of the revenant's next turn. It must also make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} by the rush of freezing water.

reaction.name: Protective Bubble {@recharge}
entries: When it would take damage, the revenant can use its reaction to prevent all damage it would take for the turn.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The whale can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The whale can hold its breath for 30 minutes

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The whale has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 5d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The whale shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The whale shark can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The whale shark makes three bite attacks. It can make one tail attack in place of one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d12 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature affected by the whale shark's Inhale, that creature is swallowed. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the whale shark, and it takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the whale shark's turns.

If the whale shark takes 40 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the whale shark must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the whale shark. If the whale shark dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from the whale shark and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Inhale
entries: The whale shark inhales water in a 15-foot cube in front of it. Each creature in that cube that is Large or smaller must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or have their movement speed reduced to 0 until the end of the whale shark's next turn.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The serpent has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the wind serpent can't constrict another target.

action.name: Lightning Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The serpent exhales lightning in a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

variant.name: Adapted Wind Serpents
entries: Wind serpents are found throughout Azeroth and have adapted differently to their climate.
You can change a wind serpent's {@b {@i lightning breath}} attack to deal {@b {@i cold}} or {@b {@i  poison}} damage instead of lightning by making the following changes to the attacks:

entries.name: Breath Attack.
entries: The breath attack becomes a 20-foot cone, and requires a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw to resist.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The serpent has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Venomous Bite
entries: Once per turn, the serpent can deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage with its bite to a target that doesn't have all its hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The serpent makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its constrict.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the wind serpent can't constrict another target.

action.name: Shocking Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. {@h}The target must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

variant.name: Adapted Wind Serpents
entries: Wind serpents are found throughout Azeroth and have adapted differently to their climate.
You can change a wind serpent's {@b {@i shocking spit}} attack to deal {@b {@i cold}} or {@b {@i  poison}} damage instead of lightning by making the following changes to the attacks:

entries.name: Spit.
entries: The breath attack requires a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw to resist.

monster.name: Wisp
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The wisp can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Variable Illumination
entries: The wisp sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

action.name: Intertwine
entries: The wisp enters the space of another creature and attempts entwine it in place. The target must pass a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. At the end of the target's turns, it can make another save, ending the paralysis on a successful one. While the wisp has a creature intertwined, attack rolls against it has disadvantage. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this wisp's intertwine for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Renew {@recharge 5}
entries: One plant that the wisp can see within 5 feet of it is renewed by the wisp; the wisp disappears. The wisp can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect while renewing a plant. The renewed plant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the plant takes fire damage, the renew doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The plant dies if it starts its turn with 0 hit points.

The renew lasts until the renewed plant drops to 0 hit points, the wisp ends it as a bonus action. When the plant takes damage, the wisp must pass a Concentration saving throw (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell) or be pushed out of the plant.

variant.name: Will of the Forest
entries: Five wisps within 30 feet of each other are able to cast powerful spells. Each of the five must use its action and movement on three consecutive turns to call upon the powers of Elune and must maintain {@status concentration} while doing so (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). When all five have finished their third turn of the ritual, the wisps gain the Spellcasting trait and can cast one spell in total at a target or point within 120 feet, no matter the spells normal range.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: The wisps spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). They can innately cast one of the following spells as a 4th-level spell, requiring no material components. If a spell requires {@status concentration}, all five wisps {@status concentration} must be broken to remove the spell:
1/ritual: {@i {@spell banishment}, {@spell charm monster}, {@spell confusion}, {@spell dispel magic}, {@spell spike growth}, {@spell wind wall}}

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The worg has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

monster.name: Wraith

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks and weapons that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Create Spawn
entries: The wraith targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that died a violent death and has been dead for no longer than 1 minute. The target's spirit rises as a wraith spawn in an unoccupied space by the corpse, under the wraith's control. The wraith spawn has the same statistics as the wraith, except that it has an Intelligence and Charisma score of 1, it cannot speak or use Create Spawn, and its Life Drain does not reduce a target creature's hit point maximum. The wraith can have no more than two wraith spawns active under its control at one time.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The wrathguard rerolls a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Legion Strike
entries: Once on each of its turns when the wrathguard makes a longsword attack, it can make another attack against a different creature that is within 5 feet of both the first creature and the wrathguard.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The wrathguard's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wrathguard makes three longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wretched's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 11}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material component

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The wretched has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wyvern makes two attacks: one bite attack and one sting attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.
{@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target.
{@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the yak moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the yak can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the yeti moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 12 ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The yeti makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@dice 1d10 + 4}) piercing.

action.name: Roar
entries: The yeti emits a roar. Each creature within 30 feet of the yeti and able to hear the roar must make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw, being {@condition Frightened} for 1 minute on a fail. A {@condition Frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the roar of all yetis for 1 day.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The dragonhawk has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the dragonhawk is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragonhawk makes two attacks with its talons.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The dragonhawk exhales fire  in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The sabercat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the zhevra moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the zhevra can make one attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

A {@b zhevra} resembles a large, striped horse with a horn piercing through its forehead, similar to that of a unicorn. Though they might seem threatening, they are usually very passive beasts; remarkably easy to frighten. They move together in herds, keeping close for their own protection.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: While out of water, the zoatroid can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The zoatroid can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until the grapple ends, the zoatroid shares space with it, the target is {@condition blinded}, and the zoatroid can't use its tentacles on another target without ending the grapple.

action.name: Enslave {@recharge}
entries: One humanoid {@condition grappled} by the zoatroid must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be enslaved by the zoatroid; the enslaved target goes on the zoatroids initiative, it controls the target's body using its actions, but it doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies. The enslave deprives the target of its vision but not its awareness. The zoatroid can be targeted by attacks, spells, and other effects, but any attack roll that misses it automatically hits its enslaved target.
The enslavement lasts until the target drops to 0 hit points, the zoatroid ends it as a bonus action, or a creature uses their action to attempt a grapple check contested by the zoatroid.

action.name: Fogged Mind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Each non-aberration creature within 10 feet of the zoatroid must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

reaction.name: Reactive Shield
entries: The zoatroid forces an attack roll that would hit it to instead hit its enslaved target. To do so, the zoatroid must be able to see the attacker.

monster.name: Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life  but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

spell.name: Amplify or Dampen Magic

components.m: something of value to the creature

entries: You manipulate the flow of mana rushing through a creature, if the creature is unwilling you must succeed on a melee spell attack before you can manipulate their flow. When you touch a creature with this spell, you choose which effect you want to affect the creature with for the spells duration.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: You amplify a creatures magical prowess. The creature takes additional damage when hit by a spell, deals additional damage when casting a spell, and restores additional hit points to a creature with a spell by an amount equal to your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Dampen
entries: You dampen a creatures magical prowess. The creature reduces damage taken by spells, damage dealt by spells, and the number of hit points restored to it by a spell by an amount equal to your spellcasting modifier.

spell.name: Arcane Barrage
entries: You manifest three bolts of raw force and launch them at a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack for each bolt. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 5d4} force damage and is pushed 10 feet directly away from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries:
When you cast this spell using a
spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell creates one more bolt for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Arcane Blast
entries: You extend your hand and make a burst of arcane energy erupt from a target within range. If the target is a creature it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} force damage. A creature forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain {@status concentration} because of this spell, makes the saving throw with disadvantage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Arcane Explosion
entries: You draw from the fluctuating arcane near you and burst with a wave of arcane power. Each other creature within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 6d8} force damage and can't take reactions until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and can use its reactions as normal.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Army of the Dead

components.m: brain matter from a humanoid killed within the past 24 hours

entries: You voice profane words, and summon an army of the dead to kill and consume everything in its path. A horde of shambling corpses appears around you, and disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

Roll initiative for the horde, which has its own turns. You cannot control the horde. It spends its turns pursing and attacking the nearest nonundead to the best of its ability. It will use its Slams action to attack and grapple creatures before moving to occupy its victims' spaces and engulf them on the next turn with its Flesh-Eating Compulsion feature. If no creatures are within its reach, the horde will use its full movement to approach any nonundead creatures it can see or hear. If no such creatures are evident, it will mindlessly follow you until targets present themselves.

When you first cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures that you can see to be ignored by the shambling horde, and which will be unaffected by its Flesh-Eating Compulsion feature. If you stop {@status concentration||concentrating} on the spell before it reaches its full duration, the horde remains for {@dice 1d6} rounds if it still has hit points, and no longer ignores these creatures.

spell.name: Asphyxiate
entries: Shadowy tendrils extend from you and swirl around the throat of a creature you can see within range. The target must make a successful Constitution saving throw or be {@condition restrained} and {@condition incapacitated} for the spells duration. While {@condition restrained} in this way, the target is unable to speak. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

spell.name: Blizzard
entries: A cold light flashes from your hand into the sky as blue shards hurl down in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, shards of freezing ice rain down upon the area.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 3d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Chain Heal
entries: A beam of restorative energies surges through a friendly creatures. Choose a target you can see within range, then choose a second target you can see within 15 feet of the first one, and a third within 15 feet range of the second target. You can't choose the same target more than once. Each target chosen by this spell regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the chain heal surges through one additional target for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Corpse Explosion

components.m: a corpse, which the spell destroys

entries: The corpse of a recently deceased creature rapidly bloats at your command and erupts in a gruesome explosion. You target the corpse of a creature that's been dead for no longer than 1 minute that you can see within range. Each creature within 5 feet of that corpse must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The radius of the explosion increases by 5 feet for every size category of the corpse above Medium.

A corpse detonated in this way is destroyed and cannot be raised or resurrected by any ability that requires a com­plete corpse. Not all creatures leave a corpse; construts and oozes almost never do, neither do incorporeal undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cyclone
entries: A whirl of wind forms around a Large or smaller creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is lifted off the ground and is {@condition restrained} for the spell's duration.

As an action, you can cause the cyclone to move up to 20 feet in a direction of your choice. A creature {@condition restrained} by the cyclone moves with it. If the cyclone moves through a space too narrow for its {@condition restrained} creature, the creature breaks out and the spell ends.

To break out, the {@condition restrained} target can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, the target escapes and is no longer {@condition restrained} by the hand. The cyclone then vanishes.

spell.name: Dark Void
entries: You pull on the veil separating reality and the void realm, creating small fissures where its maddening energies leak through. A creature within range and creatures of your choice within 5 feet of it, must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails this saving throw also can't regain hit points for 1 round.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Death and Decay
entries: You reach out towards a point you can see within range, creating a 20-foot radius sphere filled with festering, necro­tic energy that withers and decays everything within it. When a creature enters the blighted area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitu­tion saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage. In addition, until the beginning of its next turn, the creature subtracts {@dice 1d4} from all of its attack rolls and saving throws, as if under the effect of the bane spell. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and suffers no additional effects.

Undead creatures in the spell's area take no damage, and are bolstered by its necrotic power. While standing in the spell's area, undead creatures add {@dice 1d4} to their attack rolls and saving throws, as if under the effect of a bless spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Demon Skin

components.m: dried skin of a demon or fiend

entries: Your skin becomes covered in a layer of fel energy, infusing you with fiendish vigor. Your base Armor Class becomes 8 + your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum AC 10).
Additionally, your current hit points and hit point maximum each increase by 2. If ending the spell would cause your current hit point total to drop to 0 or lower, it drops to 1 instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels:
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the Armor Class granted by the spell increases by 1 and your current hit point total and hit point maximum each increase by 2 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Diabolism
entries: This spell channels a small amount of dark energy. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

items: Choose a point within 30 feet. In a 5-foot radius of that point, bright light becomes dim light, and dim light becomes darkness for 1 hour. Any light sources within the area have the light they produce suppressed for the duration.

An object up to 1 cubic foot in size or an area up to 1 square foot that you touch lightly decays. Wood rots, glass cracks, flowers wilt. Casting the spell and then continuing to touch the target advances the decay; after 1 minute, the target is destroyed. This spell cannot affect creatures, magical objects, or sturdy materials like metal and stone.

You can reanimate a Tiny 0 CR beast for 1 hour. It is undead and obeys all of your commands to the best of it's abilities, though it cannot attack. You cannot use this effect again until the reanimated creature dies, or the effect ends.
You instantaneously light a candle, torch, or small campfire. The fire glows your choice of a smoldering red, bright green, or shadowy purple until extinguished.
Your fingertip glows green or purple for up to 1 minute. While it glows, you can use your finger to draw glowing lines of the same color on a solid surface that last for 1 hour.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Drain Life
entries: You cause a green stream of energy to trail from the target creature's eyes and mouth and into your hand, forming a continuous stream of energy to bind you two together.

Make a ranged spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage, and on each of your subsequent turns for the duration, you can use your bonus action to deal {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage to the target automatically. Each time the target takes damage from this spell, you regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt and their maximum hit point total is reduced by the same amount. This reduction lasts until they finish a long rest.

On a miss, you can spend your action on subsequent turns within the spell's duration to make another ranged spell attack against the same creature. The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else.
The spell ends if your target is more than 30 feet away from you or has total cover from you at the end of your turn. This spell has no effect on the creature if they are a construct or undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels:
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st. The damage dealt as a bonus action also increases by {@dice 1d8} for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Earthen Spike
entries: You place your hand on the ground and evoke the element of earth, erupting a spike of earth at a point within range. A 5-foot radius, 15-foot high spike of earth erupts from that point. Each creature within that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d8} bludgeoning damage, or half as much damage on a success. Each creature affected by this spike is pushed away from the point of the spell to the nearest empty space. A creature who failed the saving throw falls {@condition prone}.

The earthen spike remains for the duration of the spell or until your {@status concentration} is broken at which point it crumbles, leaving its area as difficult terrain. When it crumbles, each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Elemental Shock

components.m: a piece of brimstone, granite, glass, and a feather

entries: You manifest a burst of elemental force around a creature within range. You choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder for the shock you make, the creature must then make a Dexterity saving throw. Taking {@dice 3d8} of the chosen damage type on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Fel Flame
entries: A green flame skitters across the ground towards a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage. Fel flame ignores fire resistance, and creatures immune to fire damage are considered to be resistant.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Flurry
entries: Three shards of ice streaks out toward one or more creatures within range. Make a ranged spell attack for each shard. You can direct the shards at the same target or at different ones, but they all strike simultaneously. Each shard deals {@damage 1d4} cold damage on a hit.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} per shard when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Frostfire Bolt

components.m: a piece of glass and sulfur

entries: You hurl a bolt of blue flames at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage and {@damage 2d6} cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the fire and cold damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Glacial Spike
entries: You form a large spike of ice above your head, and launch it at a creature that you can see within range, causing it to shatter across their body. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 8d8 + 40} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it is reduced to shards of ice, leaving behind everything it was wearing and carrying. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

spell.name: Ice Block
entries: Ice rapidly materializes around you, protecting you from harm. You gain 40 temporary hit points and immunity to cold damage for the spells duration. While the spell is active you can't move and take any actions or reactions. The spell remains until the temporary hit points have been expended or for the spell's duration.

spell.name: Ice Nova
entries: Frigid cold rapidly expands in a 15-foot-radius centered on a point you you can see within range. Each creature in the cold must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 10d6} cold damage and is {@condition restrained} for 1 minute as ice encases the lower part of their legs. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained} by this spell.

A creature {@condition restrained} by the ice can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself. Alternatively, the ice can be broken by dealing a total of 40 hit points worth of damage to it. It has an armor class of 10.

spell.name: Lava Burst
entries: You manifest molten stone and magma into a ferocious ball, and hurl it at a target within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 3d6} fire damage and {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage, or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} fire and bludgeoning damage for each slot above 2nd.

spell.name: Lightning Blast
entries: An arc of lightning streaks from your palms towards a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} lightning damage. If the target is wearing armor made of metal, it instead takes {@damage 1d12} lightning damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8} or {@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8} or {@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8} or {@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Living Bomb
entries: You manipulate the mana flowing through a creature within range, making it burn from the inside with a roaring fire. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d10} fire damage on a failed save. On a successful saving throw, the target takes half as much damage and the spell ends. At the start of each of your turns for as long as the the spell persists, the target must repeat the saving throw, with the same effects for success or failure.
When the spell ends the target and each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage of the explosion increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Mind Blast
entries: You attempt to pierce through the mental defenses of a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} psychic damage. If this damage would prompt a {@status concentration} check, that check is made with disadvantage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Mind Flay
entries: You wreathe the mind of a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage or half as much on a successful one.

In addition to the damage, a creature who failed the saving throw has disadvantage on all attack rolls and ability checks for the spells duration. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can reroll the Wisdom saving throw, ending this effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Shadow Bolt
entries: You fire a blast of necrotic energy at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage.
When the spell hits, you can choose to take 1 point of psychic damage to increase the damage dealt to {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage.

The spell's damage dealt increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8} or {@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8} or {@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8} or {@dice 4d12}). The optional damage taken increases by 2 when you reach 5th level (3), 11th level (5), and 17th level (7).

spell.name: Shadow Crash
entries: Shadow energy drips from your palm as you pull it towards the ground and blanket a point that you can see within range in darkness. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage and {@damage 4d8} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The darkness spreads around corner and the area of the spell is heavily obscured by magical darkness until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Solar Wrath
entries: You release a blast of the sun's wrath against a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} radiant damage and, until the end of your next turn, they radiate bright light in a 10 foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Spellsteal
entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. A 1st level spell effect of your choosing that affects the target is transferred to you. For its remaining duration, the spell's effect is applied to you as if you had cast it yourself.

If the stolen spell requires {@status concentration}, you need to concentrate on it. You do not need to provide any additional spellcasting components, if any were required by the stolen spell. Spellsteal has no effect on spells that create or summon creatures, or on spell effects that can't be removed by dispel magic.
You cannot change the stolen spell from how it was originally cast, unless its description explicitly allows it to be changed after being cast.
To steal a spell effect of 2nd level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, you successfully steal the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the spell level where you automatically succeed the check increases by one for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Starfall
entries: Countless flashes of pure moonlight fall to the ground in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. Each creature in the cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d6} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who failed the saving throw is also {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn.
If cast while outdoors with a clear view of the moon, the spell deals an additional {@damage 2d6} radiant damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Starfire
entries: A flash of light streaks down upon a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} radiant damage, and is {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn. The blindness ends early if the target takes damage from a weapon attack or spell, as the stardust blocking its eyes is swept away.
If cast while outdoors with a clear view of the moon, the spell deals an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every spell level above 1st.

spell.name: Starsurge

components.m: a rod of glass and a vial of water from a moonwell

entries: A blast of intense moonlight bursts forward in a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the burst's path must make a Dexterity saving throw; creatures sensitive to sunlight have disadvantage on their save. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If cast while outdoors with a clear view of the moon, the spell deals an additional {@damage 2d6} radiant damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Summon Void Being
entries: 4th-level conjuration

entriesHigherLevel.name: Casting Time:
entries: 1 action

entriesHigherLevel.name: Range:
entries: 90 feet

entriesHigherLevel.name: Components:
entries: V, S, M (an eyeball contained in a vial worth at least 400 gp)

entriesHigherLevel.name: Duration:
entries: Concentration, up to 1 hour

You call forth a creature from the Void. It manifests physically in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Void Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose  Mindbender, Psyfiend, or Shadowfiend. The creature resembles the creature of your choice and determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drop to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after your. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge} action and it uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast the spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears on the stat block.

spell.name: Void Shift
entries: You call upon the void to shift the health of you and another creature. Choose a willing creature within range, you and the chosen creature exchange your current hit points, to a maximum of 40 hit points from each creature. This spell has no effect on a creature who is {@condition incapacitated} or at 0 hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the maximum hit points you can exchange increases by 10 for each slot level above 4th.
